channel.title: Engineering Radio
channel.description: Have you heard Engineering Radio, the new radio program for design engineers from the editors of Electronic Design? Tune in every Monday at 2pm ET for the newest episodes -- we'll cover everything from LEDs to Robots to Ham Radio!
channel.itunes:summary: Have you heard Engineering Radio, the new radio program for design engineers from the editors of Electronic Design? Tune in every Monday at 2pm ET for the newest episodes -- we'll cover everything from LEDs to Robots to Ham Radio!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Electronic Design
channel.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 26: TI App; AUVSI Highlights
item.itunes:subtitle: Analog Editor Don Tuite does a test run of a new mobile app from TI for design engineers. Next, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on three of his favorite unmanned vehicles from AUVSI. Then, Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on LEDs...
item.itunes:summary: Analog Editor Don Tuite does a test run of a new mobile app from TI for design engineers. Next, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on three of his favorite unmanned vehicles from AUVSI. Then, Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on LEDs, a new robotics web site and nuclear sensors. Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito finishes up with a couple of interesting news items.
item.description: Analog Editor Don Tuite does a test run of a new mobile app from TI for design engineers. Next, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on three of his favorite unmanned vehicles from AUVSI. Then, Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on LEDs...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 25: OP Engine; Botka On Wireless
item.itunes:subtitle: Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports from MVEC on a new opposed-piston engine. Guest contributor Andy Botkin of Agilent Technologies comments on engineering challenges in a complex wireless market.
item.itunes:summary: Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports from MVEC on a new opposed-piston engine. Guest contributor Andy Botkin of Agilent Technologies comments on engineering challenges in a complex wireless market. Test Editor David Maliniak interviews Dr. James Truchard, CEO of National Instruments. Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on the dearth of rare earth metals and more.
item.description: Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports from MVEC on a new opposed-piston engine. Guest contributor Andy Botkin of Agilent Technologies comments on engineering challenges in a complex wireless market.
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 24: CUI Interview; $10M L Prize
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito interviews Jeff Smoot, VP of Engineering at CUI, about the company's Solus topology for dc-dc converters. Power Technology Editor Don Tuite comments on Philips winning the $10M L(ighting) Prize.
item.itunes:summary: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito interviews Jeff Smoot, VP of Engineering at CUI, about the company's Solus topology for dc-dc converters. Power Technology Editor Don Tuite comments on Philips winning the $10M L(ighting) Prize. Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on the new Linux 3.0 kernel and interviews Bill Hutchings of Microchip. And lots more.
item.description: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito interviews Jeff Smoot, VP of Engineering at CUI, about the company's Solus topology for dc-dc converters. Power Technology Editor Don Tuite comments on Philips winning the $10M L(ighting) Prize.
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 23: TI PowerStack; VITA Standard
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, power technology editor Don Tuite comments on PowerStack technology from Texas Instruments. Then, embedded technology editor Bill Wong reports on new VITA standards and Power.org's Fawzi Behmann updates listeners on the Power Architecture. Comp
item.itunes:summary: This week, power technology editor Don Tuite comments on PowerStack technology from Texas Instruments. Then, embedded technology editor Bill Wong reports on new VITA standards and Power.org's Fawzi Behmann updates listeners on the Power Architecture. Components editor Mat Dirjish reports on new LEDs and digital panel displays and EiC Joe Desposito reports on news of the week.
item.description: This week, power technology editor Don Tuite comments on PowerStack technology from Texas Instruments. Then, embedded technology editor Bill Wong reports on new VITA standards and Power.org's Fawzi Behmann updates listeners on the Power Architecture. Comp

item.title: Episode 22: Embedded Report; Flywheels
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on new products from Seamicro and McObject. He also interviews Jean Anne Booth of TI about a new Stellaris Blutooth kit. Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on new LEDs and a tantalum cap...
item.itunes:summary: This week, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on new products from Seamicro and McObject. He also interviews Jean Anne Booth of TI about a new Stellaris Blutooth kit. Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on new LEDs and a tantalum cap. Joe Desposito reports on a news item about flywheels, and European Editor Paul Whytock comments on REACH legislation.
item.description: This week, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on new products from Seamicro and McObject. He also interviews Jean Anne Booth of TI about a new Stellaris Blutooth kit. Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on new LEDs and a tantalum cap...

item.title: Episode 21: T&M Report; New Solar Cells
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Test and Measurement Editor David Maliniak reports on new test gear from Keithley Instruments and Agilent Technologies. Bill Wong talks about his visit to RSi, a company that is making solar cells in a new way...
item.itunes:summary: This week, Test and Measurement Editor David Maliniak reports on new test gear from Keithley Instruments and Agilent Technologies. Bill Wong talks about his visit to RSi, a company that is making solar cells in a new way. Components Editor Mat Dirjish reports on two new products from Avago Technologies, Joe Desposito interviews Scott Roller, VP of Microcontrollers at TI, and more.
item.description: This week, Test and Measurement Editor David Maliniak reports on new test gear from Keithley Instruments and Agilent Technologies. Bill Wong talks about his visit to RSi, a company that is making solar cells in a new way...

item.title: Episode 20: New LED Driver; NVM Express
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Analog Editor Don Tuite comments on a new LED driver from iWatt. Then, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong follows with his thoughts on the NVM Express standard for non-volatile memory. Components Editor Mat Dirjish uncovers two breakthrough..
item.itunes:summary: This week, Analog Editor Don Tuite comments on a new LED driver from iWatt. Then, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong follows with his thoughts on the NVM Express standard for non-volatile memory. Components Editor Mat Dirjish uncovers two breakthrough sensors from Baolab Microsystems and Plessey Semiconductors, while Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito comments on HP's TouchPad.
item.description: This week, Analog Editor Don Tuite comments on a new LED driver from iWatt. Then, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong follows with his thoughts on the NVM Express standard for non-volatile memory. Components Editor Mat Dirjish uncovers two breakthrough..

item.title: Episode 19: Atom Roadmap; H.E.A.T. EVM
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about the Intel Atom roadmap and the new H.E.A.T. EVM from Texas Instruments. Then, embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on Tilera's Tile GX 3000 Series multicore processors...
item.itunes:summary: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about the Intel Atom roadmap and the new H.E.A.T. EVM from Texas Instruments. Then, Embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on Tilera's Tile GX 3000 Series multicore processors, and Communications Editor Lou Frenzel reports on Pergrine Semi's new digital tuning cap. Power Editor Don Tuite explains Smart Grid domains.
item.description: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about the Intel Atom roadmap and the new H.E.A.T. EVM from Texas Instruments. Then, embedded Technology Editor Bill Wong reports on Tilera's Tile GX 3000 Series multicore processors...

item.title: Episode 18: QorIQ Update; G.hn Interview
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, embedded technology editor Bill Wong, gives you his first impression of the new AMP Series QorIQ processor. Then communications editor Lou Frenzel interviews Chano Gomez, co-chair of the Home Grid working group, about the current status of ...
item.itunes:summary: This week, embedded technology editor Bill Wong, gives you his first impression of the new AMP Series QorIQ processor. Then communications editor Lou Frenzel interviews Chano Gomez, co-chair of the Home Grid working group, about the current status of the G.hn home networking standard. Next up, components editor, Mat Dirjish reviews ST's new touch chip, and more.
item.description: This week, embedded technology editor Bill Wong, gives you his first impression of the new AMP Series QorIQ processor. Then communications editor Lou Frenzel interviews Chano Gomez, co-chair of the Home Grid working group, about the current status of ...

item.title: Episode 17: $1/W Solar; Wireless Sensors
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, power editor Don Tuite comments on IHS iSuppli's report on $1 per watt solar modules. Embedded editor Bill Wong gives his take on wireless sensors and a new resistive touch chip. EDA editor David Maliniak talks about how EDA might see...
item.itunes:summary: This week, power editor Don Tuite comments on IHS iSuppli's report on $1 per watt solar modules. Embedded editor Bill Wong gives his take on wireless sensors and a new resistive touch chip. EDA editor David Maliniak talks about how EDA might see significant growth in the future, Paul Whytock, Editor-in-chief of Electronic Design Europe, comments on the Nokia-Apple legal tiff, and more.
item.description: This week, power editor Don Tuite comments on IHS iSuppli's report on $1 per watt solar modules. Embedded editor Bill Wong gives his take on wireless sensors and a new resistive touch chip. EDA editor David Maliniak talks about how EDA might see...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 16: Transparent LCDs; Element14
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about advanced LCD technology—transparent LCDs and PenTile technology. He also gives you his take on the new Element14 Knode. Joe then comments on a new cloud computing initiative from IBM aimed directly...
item.itunes:summary: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about advanced LCD technology—transparent LCDs and PenTile technology. He also gives you his take on the new Element14 Knode. Joe then comments on a new cloud computing initiative from IBM aimed directly at the design engineering community. He also talks about one of his favorite topics, heart rate monitors, and the chips that drive them.
item.description: This week, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about advanced LCD technology—transparent LCDs and PenTile technology. He also gives you his take on the new Element14 Knode. Joe then comments on a new cloud computing initiative from IBM aimed directly...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 15: Tuite on Powercast; SparkFun
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Don Tuite talks about Powercast's RF energy harvesting platform, while Mat Dirjish interviews Nathan Seidle, CEO of SparkFun. Bill Wong introduces a new multicore MCU from Adapteva and talks about his trip to ISEF. Finally, Mat Dirjish put
item.itunes:summary: This week, Don Tuite talks about Powercast's RF energy harvesting platform, while Mat Dirjish interviews Nathan Seidle, CEO of SparkFun. Bill Wong introduces a new multicore MCU from Adapteva and talks about his trip to ISEF. Finally, Mat Dirjish puts the finishing touches on the program with a report from the recent Lightfair International trade show.
item.description: This week, Don Tuite talks about Powercast's RF energy harvesting platform, while Mat Dirjish interviews Nathan Seidle, CEO of SparkFun. Bill Wong introduces a new multicore MCU from Adapteva and talks about his trip to ISEF. Finally, Mat Dirjish put

item.title: Episode 14: SAE Wrap; Mobile Multicore
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Contributing Editor Randy Frank wraps up SAE 2011 World Congress, while Contributing Editor Joe Hallett reports on SID Display Week. In addition, Contributing Editor Linley Gwennap talks about multicore processors for mobile computing...
item.itunes:summary: This week, Contributing Editor Randy Frank wraps up SAE 2011 World Congress, while Contributing Editor Joe Hallett reports on SID Display Week. In addition, Contributing Editor Linley Gwennap talks about multicore processors for mobile computing. Finally, Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito reports on third-generation range extenders for hybrid cars and IP addresses for light bulbs.
item.description: This week, Contributing Editor Randy Frank wraps up SAE 2011 World Congress, while Contributing Editor Joe Hallett reports on SID Display Week. In addition, Contributing Editor Linley Gwennap talks about multicore processors for mobile computing...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 13: More Embedded; Touch At SID
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Bill Wong talks about recently released embedded hardware and software products. Then Electronic Design contributor Guillaume Largillier gets his crew at Stantum to discuss touch technology and wrap up a touch technology panel at last week's
item.itunes:summary: This week, Bill Wong talks about recently released embedded hardware and software products. Then Electronic Design contributor Guillaume Largillier gets his crew at Stantum to discuss touch technology and wrap up a touch technology panel at last week's SID Display Week symposium. Finally, Paul Whytock reports on last week's PCIM conference held in Nuremburg.
item.description: This week, Bill Wong talks about recently released embedded hardware and software products. Then Electronic Design contributor Guillaume Largillier gets his crew at Stantum to discuss touch technology and wrap up a touch technology panel at last week's

item.title: Episode 12: Lidow on GaN; Made in the USA
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Electronic Design Europe Editor in Chief Paul Whytock interviews Alex Lidow, cofounder and CEO of Efficient Power Conversion Corp. (EPC), about the latest in GaN technology and its applications. In another segment...
item.itunes:summary: This week, Electronic Design Europe Editor in Chief Paul Whytock interviews Alex Lidow, cofounder and CEO of Efficient Power Conversion Corp. (EPC), about the latest in GaN technology and its applications. In another segment, Components Editor Mat Dirjish talks about his “Made in America” blog post, the comments it generated, and how he got the idea to write about it.
item.description: This week, Electronic Design Europe Editor in Chief Paul Whytock interviews Alex Lidow, cofounder and CEO of Efficient Power Conversion Corp. (EPC), about the latest in GaN technology and its applications. In another segment...

item.title: Episode 11: ESC Wrap-up; the Chevy Volt
item.itunes:subtitle: Hear about the technologies that Editors Bill Wong, Joe Desposito, and Don Tuite saw at last week's Embedded Systems Conference, including the first commercial embedded SE Linux platform, the latest microcontrollers, and embedded hardware...
item.itunes:summary: Hear about the technologies that Editors Bill Wong, Joe Desposito, and Don Tuite saw at last week's Embedded Systems Conference, including the first commercial embedded SE Linux platform, the latest microcontrollers, and embedded hardware. Also, Managing Editor Rich Gawel goes for a ride in the Chevy Volt with Product Specialist Samantha Lozon at the recent New York International Auto Show, demonstrating its charging station, instrumentation, and acceleration.
item.description: Hear about the technologies that Editors Bill Wong, Joe Desposito, and Don Tuite saw at last week's Embedded Systems Conference, including the first commercial embedded SE Linux platform, the latest microcontrollers, and embedded hardware...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 10: ESC Preview; Encoder Talk
item.itunes:subtitle: Embedded Editor Bill Wong previews the Embedded Systems Conference in San Jose. He also talks with Jim Handy of Objective Analysis about the Samsung and Seagate merger and what it means for hard disks. Bill talks about encoders and their role...
item.itunes:summary: Embedded Editor Bill Wong previews the Embedded Systems Conference in San Jose. He also talks with Jim Handy of Objective Analysis about the Samsung and Seagate merger and what it means for hard disks. Bill talks about encoders and their role in embedded systems as well. Meanwhile, Managing Editor Rich Gawel went for a ride in Nissan's all-electric Leaf at the New York International Audio Show and reports on its charging station, instrumentation, and acceleration.
item.description: Embedded Editor Bill Wong previews the Embedded Systems Conference in San Jose. He also talks with Jim Handy of Objective Analysis about the Samsung and Seagate merger and what it means for hard disks. Bill talks about encoders and their role...
item.author: bill.wong@penton.com (Bill Wong)
item.itunes:author: Bill Wong

item.title: Episode 9: Haptics; Space Symposium
item.itunes:subtitle: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about haptics hardware and software with Technology Editor Bill Wong. Will haptics give Android smartphones a leg up with the gaming crowd over the iPhone and iPod Touch? Then Bill Wong talks about his travels to the...
item.itunes:summary: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about haptics hardware and software with Technology Editor Bill Wong. Will haptics give Android smartphones a leg up with the gaming crowd over the iPhone and iPod Touch? Then Bill Wong talks about his travels to the 27th National Space Symposium and some of the neat new technologies he uncovered at that show.
item.description: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about haptics hardware and software with Technology Editor Bill Wong. Will haptics give Android smartphones a leg up with the gaming crowd over the iPhone and iPod Touch? Then Bill Wong talks about his travels to the...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 8: Wireless Power; MEMS Tech
item.itunes:subtitle: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about wireless power with Technology Editor Don Tuite. Will your next lamp really have wireless charging built in? Joe also brings a reader's insight into the discussion. In another segment, Joe talks about MEMS...
item.itunes:summary: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about wireless power with Technology Editor Don Tuite. Will your next lamp really have wireless charging built in? Joe also brings a reader's insight into the discussion. In another segment, Joe talks about MEMS and provides insight into the markets for these devices as well as some of the latest components available to designers today.
item.description: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about wireless power with Technology Editor Don Tuite. Will your next lamp really have wireless charging built in? Joe also brings a reader's insight into the discussion. In another segment, Joe talks about MEMS...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 7: TI Acquisition; Medical Design
item.itunes:subtitle: Editor-in-chief Joe Desposito talks about TI's acquisition of National Semiconductor and what it may mean to design engineers. In another segment, both Joe and analog editor Don Tuite explain some of the technologies finding their way into medical...
item.itunes:summary: Editor-in-chief Joe Desposito talks about TI's acquisition of National Semiconductor and what it may mean to design engineers. In another segment, both Joe and analog editor Don Tuite explain some of the technologies finding their way into medical devices. We wrap up the show with more TI news. TI jumped back to the top of the MEMs heap in 2010 thanks to its DLP chips.
item.description: Editor-in-chief Joe Desposito talks about TI's acquisition of National Semiconductor and what it may mean to design engineers. In another segment, both Joe and analog editor Don Tuite explain some of the technologies finding their way into medical...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 6: New Interfaces; CTIA Wrap
item.itunes:subtitle: Editor-in-chief Joe Desposito talks with embedded technology editor Bill Wong about new interfaces that have come on the scene recently such as Thunderbolt, PCIe 3.0, MHL and HDP. In another segment, communications editor Lou Frenzel gives listeners...
item.itunes:summary: Editor-in-chief Joe Desposito talks with embedded technology editor Bill Wong about new interfaces that have come on the scene recently such as Thunderbolt, PCIe 3.0, MHL and HDP. In another segment, communications editor Lou Frenzel gives listeners a whirlwind tour of the recently concluded International CTIA Wireless show.
item.description: Editor-in-chief Joe Desposito talks with embedded technology editor Bill Wong about new interfaces that have come on the scene recently such as Thunderbolt, PCIe 3.0, MHL and HDP. In another segment, communications editor Lou Frenzel gives listeners...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)

item.title: Episode 5: More Quake News; Moore for Test
item.itunes:subtitle: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about his experience with tsunami night in Hawaii and the mathematical models that drove the evacuation. He also gives an update on the quake's effect on the electronics industry as more reports roll in.
item.itunes:summary: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about his experience with tsunami night in Hawaii and the mathematical models that drove the evacuation. He also gives an update on the quake's effect on the electronics industry as more reports roll in. In another segment, test editor David Maliniak reveals how Moore's law is affecting test. In the Q and A segment, Joe answers a listener's question concerning blue LEDs and the “droop” effect.
item.description: Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito talks about his experience with tsunami night in Hawaii and the mathematical models that drove the evacuation. He also gives an update on the quake's effect on the electronics industry as more reports roll in.
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito

item.title: Episode 4: Earthquakes and Tech Shows
item.itunes:subtitle: Technology Editor Bill Wong will be talking with Jim Handy of Objective Analysis about the affects of the earthquake on the semiconductor market.
item.itunes:summary: Technology Editor Bill Wong will be talking with Jim Handy of Objective Analysis about the affects of the earthquake on the semiconductor market. Don Tuite, our analog and power technology editor, will be talking about APEC. Paul Whytock, editor of Electronic Design Europe, tells about his experiences at the Embedded World conference and the Mobile World Congress show.
item.description: Technology Editor Bill Wong will be talking with Jim Handy of Objective Analysis about the affects of the earthquake on the semiconductor market.
item.author: bill.wong@penton.com (Bill Wong)
item.itunes:author: Bill Wong

item.title: Episode 3: Robot OS
item.itunes:subtitle: Technology editor Bill Wong talks about some of the latest robots that are one sale as well as the ROS, the Robot Operating System. ROS is an open source project hosted by Willow Garage. Bill talks about Willow Garage's pool playing PR2 robot...
item.itunes:summary: Technology editor Bill Wong talks about some of the latest robots as well as the ROS (Robot Operating System) which is an open source project hosted by Willow Garage. Bill investigates Willow Garage's pool playing PR2 robot. He talks with Daniel Mellinger from the University of Penn GRASP lab about cooperative quadrotor robots running ROS as well as Segolene Roche from Gostai about their new telepresence robot, the Jazz Connect.
item.description: Technology editor Bill Wong talks about some of the latest robots that are one sale as well as the ROS, the Robot Operating System. ROS is an open source project hosted by Willow Garage. Bill talks about Willow Garage's pool playing PR2 robot...
item.author: bill.wong@penton.com (Bill Wong)
item.itunes:author: Bill Wong

item.title: Episode 2: Home Theater Systems
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's hot topic is wireless home theater speakers. Can you really get high-quality sound from wireless speakers?...
item.itunes:summary: Hosted by Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito, this episode of Engineering Radio delves inside the hot topic of wireless home theater speakers. Can you really get high-quality sound from wireless speakers? With enough engineering, you can. Joe will bring along editors Bill Wong, Lou Frenzel, and Don Tuite to talk about how companies are combining audio, wireless, and ultrasonic technologies to make home theater speaker setup a snap.
item.description: This week's hot topic is wireless home theater speakers. Can you really get high-quality sound from wireless speakers?...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito
item.itunes:keywords: Wireless, Speakers, Bill, Wong, Engineering, Radio

item.title: Episode 1: Analog Guru Bob Pease Interview
item.itunes:subtitle: Hosted by Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito, Engineering Radio will launch with a sparkling lineup for its first Internet broadcast. At the top of the list of interviewees is analog guru and longtime Electronic Design columnist Bob Pease...
item.itunes:summary: In this first episode of Engineering Radio, host Joe Desposito will try to answer the question: Are LCDs ready for an RGB makeover? Embedded Editor Bill Wong will join Joe in the color debate, which has lots to do with LED backlighting, as well as tell us about other image enhancements that are coming down the pike via digital processing. And the moment you've been waiting for – we'll wrap with an interview analog guru and longtime Electronic Design columnist Bob Pease.
item.description: Hosted by Editor-in-Chief Joe Desposito, Engineering Radio will launch with a sparkling lineup for its first Internet broadcast. At the top of the list of interviewees is analog guru and longtime Electronic Design columnist Bob Pease...
item.author: joe.desposito@penton.com (Joe Desposito)
item.itunes:author: Joe Desposito
